channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: “Lift & Learn” Sessions Begin January 29
item.description: Date: Wednesday, January 29, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - In this fitness and nutrition program, led by our experienced strength and conditioning coach, participants will engage in guided workout sessions tailored to various fitness levels and learn about proper nutrition to support their fitness goals. Please contact Emma Atkinson for more info or to sign up!
item.author: Students

item.title: Counseling Center Announces Walk-in Hours for Spring 2025
item.description: Rensselaer’s Counseling Center invites students to meet with a counselor without a formal appointment during designated walk-in hours! Two walk-in hours are available each day: from 10am to noon on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays, and from 2:00pm to 4:00pm Tuesdays and Thursdays. Walk-in counseling is also available on a first-come, first-served basis on days when classes are in session; students who cannot attend the walk-in times can call (518) 276-6479 to schedule an appointment.
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE Online Workshop to Offer Tips for Dissertation, Thesis Preparation and Submission
item.description: Date: Wednesday, February 5, 2025 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus review the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them! This workshop is for any student who will be writing an MS thesis or PhD dissertation, so be sure to register and bring your questions!

item.title: New Apartment Search Site Launched
item.description: Date: Tuesday, January 28, 2025 - Wed , February 12, 2025 (all day) - The Off-Campus Commons would like to announce its new search platform, an enhanced site to help make your apartment search easier! Students who create an account for this new platform by Thursday, February 13 will be entered in a raffle.

item.title: Burgermaster Wins AIA Tri-State Design Award
item.description: RPI School of Architecture Professor Matt Burgermaster and his office MABU have received a 2024 Tri-State Design Award from the American Institute of Architects for the project “Twenty Ways Home.” The Tri-State Design Awards is a bi-annual program that recognizes regional design excellence across the states of New York, New Jersey, and Pennsylvania.

item.title: Architecture Announces Spring 2025 Lecture Series
item.description: Rensselaer Architecture is pleased to announce its full lecture series for spring 2025, which will begin with Ludwig Godefroy’s “Concordance” on January 29. Unless otherwise noted, all events will start at 5:00pm at the EMPAC Theater and admission is free.

item.title: RPIrates Monthly Meeting, “Put Your Data on Maps with Leaflet in R!,” to be Held January 29
item.description: RPI R users are invited to meeting of RPIrates, the RPI R Users Group! This week’s topic will be “Put Your Data on Maps with Leaflet in R!,” led by Dr. John S. Erickson, Director of Research Operations of the Future of Computing Institute (FOCI) at Rensselaer. The session will discuss how R’s Leaflet package makes it easy for users to create interactive maps that present data analyses in powerful, compelling, geographically-relevant ways.

item.title: Office of Undergraduate Education: Access HelioCampus with Chrome Browser
item.description: As of mid-morning on Monday, January 27, the Office of Undergraduate Education reports that it is having difficulty accessing browsers typically supported by HelioCampus. While the Office is looking into the issue and hopes to have it solved very soon, in the meantime users are encouraged to use Chrome to access HelioCampus, as it is the one browser that is currently successful in accessing the tool and its necessary features.
item.author: Community

item.title: ECSE Mourns the Passing of Professor Mona Hella
item.description:
The ECSE Department is heartbroken to report that Professor Mona Hella passed away on January 20, 2025. Her passing is a devastating loss to her family, and to ECSE and RPI, and she will be dearly missed. A commemorative event for Mona will be held at 1:30pm on February 8 at the Chapel+Cultural Center, located at 2125 Burdett Avenue in Troy.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
